solution.text:
let the number of conical vessels required be x.
_{l}_ \(\times \) Volume of the cylinder = x \(\times \)volume of the cone
Now volume of the cylinder\(=_{l}_\times [\pi \times r^2\times l]\) radius of the cylinder=\(_{j}_\) and l=_{k}_
\(\Rightarrow _{l}_\times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_\)
volume of the cones\(=x\times [ \frac 13 \times \pi \times r^2 \times height]\)
height of the cylinders = height of the cone= _{k}_and radius of the base of the cone = radius of the cylinder
volume of the cones\(= x\times [ \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_]\)
Now the total volumes of both the vessels should be equal\(x\times [ \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_]=_{l}_\times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_\)
\(\Rightarrow x=_{{l*3}}_\)

content.text:
Water is filled in _{l}_ cylindrical vessels of radius _{j}_cm and height _{k}_cm
The shape of the vessels needs to be changed to conical, keeping the radius and height same as that of the cylinder.
Find the number of conical vessels required to empty all the cylindrical vessels
